required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Genetiska Orsaker Till familjär Hyperkolesterolemi- Mekanism, Prognos Och Individanpassad Behandling

brief_summary.textblock: Familial hypercholesterolemia (FH) is a common disease. The genetic background to FH is not yet fully understood. In the present prospective cohort study we aim to study the association between different clinical characteristics, gene mutations and prognosis.

detailed_description.textblock:
In this prospective observational cohort study of patients with high clinical suspicion of familial hypercholesterolemia (FH) we aim to study the association between different clinical characteristics, gene mutations and prognosis.
The included patients will undergo physical examination and extended blood sampling. DNA will be extracted and used for both whole genome sequencing and investigation of both known- , unknown- and suspected mutations associated with FH.
The patients will be followed in for 15 years in the Swedish patients registry and the Swedish cause of death registry.

primary_outcome.description: The prevalence of known and newly discovered mutations associated with FH in the study population.

secondary_outcome.description: Time to death (cardiovascular and total), hospitalization due to acute myocardial infarction, unstable angina, heart failure or stroke.
Time to the individual endpoints: death (cardiovascular and total), hospitalization due to acute myocardial infarction, unstable angina, heart failure, stroke.

arm_group.description: Patients with high clinical suspicion of familial hypercholesterolemia. No intervention.

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples for investigation of lipids, electrolytes, markers of inflammation and myocardial injury. Blood samples for extraction of DNA for genetic analysis.

study_pop.textblock: All patients with suspected FH referred to the cardiac clinic at Orebro University hospital and their first grade relatives.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age 8 years or older.
2. Clinical suspicion of FH
3. Dutch Lipid Clinic Network Score of at least four or a first grade relative with a genetic deviation that may be associated with FH.
Exclusion Criteria:
1) Age below 8 years.
